intro: Erodium cicutarium var. commixtum, commonly known as common erodium, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to reddish flowers, which are borne on short pedicels. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
